result.execSummary:
The defendant Gilbert J Gondek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two, but consecutive to sentence he is currently serving.  No huber privileges.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Court found defendant indigent and waived all costs and surcharges.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one, but consecutive to sentence he is currently serving.  No huber privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gilbert J Gondek

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gilbert J Gondek in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Gilbert J Gondek in custody.  Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Sentencing proceeds.   
 Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification.
 Statements by counsel and defendant.  
As to both counts as amended:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 60 days at the House of Correction, as to each count, concurrent with each other but consecutive to the sentence he is now serving,  with no huber privileges and -0- days credit.
The court found the defendant was indigent and waived all costs and surcharges.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Gilbert J Gondek in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Gilbert J Gondek in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI  

On motion of the State, Court ordered charges amended as follows:

Count 1:

Charge as Disorderly Conduct, Habitual Criminality Repeater, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes Sections 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 939.62(1)(a).

Count 2:

Charge as Disorderly Conduct, Habitual Criminality Repeater, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes Sections 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 939.62(1)(a).

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY as to both counts.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as to both counts. Judgment of conviction entered. Case calendered for Sentencing in Br. 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Gilbert J Gondek not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for today's date.
Defense counsel is requesting a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gilbert J Gondek in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.
  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 36 for a scheduling conference.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Stephanie K., ZJG (8/6/08, and RLG (8/11/10).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gilbert J Gondek in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Gilbert J Gondek in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 36.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Gilbert J Gondek
Current: 1950 S 31st St, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 01-15-2016)
Prior: 1730 North 7th Street, #34, Milwaukee, WI 53205
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
